text: A couple of debug enhancements for PropertySetter, trivial but useful.
creator: lilianne_blaze@tlen.pl
hoju@visi.com
text:
Please describe the usefulness of the patch for people who won't bother looking
at it (like me) until there's an adequate description of what it does.  If the
description is in the patch, copy it to a comment in this report so it can be
seen without having to look at the patch.

Jake

creator: lilianne_blaze@tlen.pl
text:
Mostly it just outputs a list of available properties of an object, so it speeds
up debugging of typos / misdesigned setter-getter pairs.

Added in introspect() - log.warn("no props found in obj") / log.debug("props
propOne propTwo(r-o) in obj")

Added in getPropertyDescriptor(name) - log.debug("getPropertyDescriptor(name)
called")

As I said, trivial but time-saving.

creator: genman@noderunner.net
text:
I'm committing some of the patch and also added a test case.

In particular, I noticed that every Object has at least a "class" attribute so
it's impossible to generate any warning in a unit test.

Committed by eross in rev 500453 and 500454.  Not sure that the unit test is actually run by tests/
build.xml.  Not a candidate for backporting to log4j 1.2 in my opinion.
creator: carnold@apache.org
